1. Measure 1 g of Ac, 1 g of Cd, 3 g of In, and 1 g of Sr using a precise scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured ingredients. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform consistency is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 1 g of Ac, 1 g of Cd, 3 g of In, and 1 g of Sr using a precise scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured ingredients. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform consistency is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a ceramic crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a muffle furnace. 3. Set the furnace to heat to 800 °C. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper synthesis.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a ceramic crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a muffle furnace. 3. Set the furnace to heat to 800 °C. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper synthesis.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the synthesized material to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, seal the surface using a suitable epoxy for durability.
